TopicTitle: "Ground distance covered" vs MechJeb. Which is true?

Articles.Content:
So, I took off from KSC, climbed to 5000 m. and flew for a certain amount of time. I am trying to determine my aircraft range but I have two different indications. MechJeb tells me I made 88.73 km from the Space Center, however KSP flight data gives me 58.55km ground covered. Thing is I flew straight the whole time, so all the distance covered is supposed to be while going away from KSC. Does this have to do anything with the planet's rotation? And which one should be trust more to get the real range?

Edited July 24, 2014 by Tsynique
It could be that Mechjeb switched directions. Instead of backwards, it's now forwards

Next time you launch, check the distances again. But without moving. It's probably just a difference from where MJ spots the runway and your launch point.

Get out and plant a flag at the back end of the runway. All problems solved.

Ok, my mistake.. I realized what I was interpreting wrongly. Distance to runway displayed my MJ is downrange distance both vertically and horizontally. Whereas "Ground distance covered" is just horizontally.

Thanks for the replies also
